hanzi-su-wiki:
握

Значения

Брать, держать; завладевать

Мнемоника

Своими руками 扌 захватить чужое жильё 屋.
purpleculture_pinyin:
wò
to hold; to grasp; to clench (one's fist); to master; classifier: a handful
держать; схватить; сжать (кулак); освоить; классификатор: горстка
rtega_mnemonic:
握握RSgrasp, hold fast, take by hand
  • hand 扌 grasping things in the room 屋 of the house to work on them
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 屋 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
掌握 [ zhǎng wò ]: to grasp (often fig.); to control; to seize (initiative, opportunity, destiny); to master; to know well; to understand sth well and know how to use it; fluency
把握 [ bǎ wò ]: to grasp (also fig.); to seize; to hold; assurance; certainty; sure (of the outcome)
握手 [ wò shǒu ]: to shake hands
在握 [ zài wò ]: (fig.) to hold in one's hands; to be within grasp
握别 [ wò bié ]: to shake hands
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 屋 [ wū ] building, house, shelter; room
heisig_chinese_memo: Fingers gripping the roof of your habitation as you're about to fall.&nbsp
heisig_constituent: grip, finger, fingers, roof, flag climax, wall, one, ceiling, elbow, soil, dirt, ground
koohiiStory1: Fingers gripping the roof as your about to fall to your death. Think of an action scene in some movie.
koohiiStory2: (This is the にぎ of sushi). A sushi chef climaxes into a rice ball, wraps it in an American flag, and grips is firm with his fingers to form the "Fuck You America Onigiri.".
jp_example_words:
把握(はあく): grasp, catch, understanding
握手(あくしゅ): handshake
握る(にぎる): grasp, seize, mould (sushi)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You use your fingers in a shop to grip what you want to buy.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine picking up a few different things in a shop. If something fits nicely in your grip: buy it. If it's too small or too big, put it back.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You have a really strong grip thanks to acupuncture (あく)! All your fingers are primed for buying things. You can grip anything at a shop—pineapples, tires, even live turtles. All thanks to some well-placed needles.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Acupuncture is great for strengthening your grip strength. If you do intense shopping (like I do) you should definitely consider it!
Ru_Radicals: 厶 (значок МУ), 土 (земля), 尸 (труп), 扎, 至 (наиболее)
Ru_trainchinese: wò: (глаг) держать, схватывать; пожимать (руки); владеть, контролировать; сжимать (кулак)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hand (扌) by the roof (屋) grasps it
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Fingers gripping the roof of your habitation as you're about to fall.&nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " hand " and " house ", the original meaning is to hold and hold. "Shuowen": "Snip it. From the hand, the sound of the house." The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diaolong‧ Harmony": "The shape of Zhang Hua is like holding a pestle."

" Grasp " can mean flexing your fingers into a fist. "Zhuangzi‧ Geng Sangchu": "While holding your hands all day long, you share your virtues." Lu Deming explained: "Hold, Li Yun: Juan said to hold."

" Grasp " also means mastery and control. "Zuo Zhuan-The Second Year of the Min Gong": "The body is biased, and it is necessary to hold the soldier. In this trip, I will encourage it."

" Grasp " also refers to the hand with the fingers flexed. Yuan Cao Boqi, "Nanxiangzi-Sichuan Daozhong": "I can't hold two hands, I overlook the flying stream over the rocky beach."

" Holding " also means to seal or cover. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 19: "Anxious Assailant hurriedly shook his mouth."

" Grasp " is also used as a measure word, referring to the amount that a hand can hold or the length of a punch. "Book of Rites-King System": "The ox of the heaven and the earth has a cocoon and chestnut; the ox of the ancestral temple has a horn grip." Zheng Xuan's note: "The grip means that the skin cannot grow out."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " hand " and " house ", the original meaning is to hold and hold.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「屋」聲，本義為執持、握持。《說文》：「搤持也。从手，屋聲。」 南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧諧隱》：「張華之形，比乎握舂杵。」

　　「握」可表示屈指成拳。《莊子‧庚桑楚》：「終日握而手不掜，共其德也。」陸德明釋文：「握，李云：捲曰握。」

　　「握」也表示掌握、控制。《左傳‧閔公二年》：「衣身之偏，握兵之要，在此行也，子其勉之。」

　　「握」還指拳屈手指的手。元曹伯啟〈南鄉子‧四川道中作〉：「兩握不曾握，俯瞰飛流過石灘。」

　　「握」亦表示封、遮蓋。《紅樓夢》第19回：「急的襲人忙握他的嘴。」

　　「握」也用作量詞，指一手所能執持的量或一拳的長度。《禮記‧王制》：「祭天地之牛，角繭栗；宗廟之牛，角握。」鄭玄注：「握謂長不出膚。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「屋」聲，本義為執持、握持。

握别 [ wò bié ]: to shake hands

從「 手 」，「 屋 」聲，本義為執持、握持。《說文》：「搤持也。从手，屋聲。」 南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧諧隱》：「張華之形，比乎握舂杵。」 「 握 」可表示屈指成拳。《莊子‧庚桑楚》：「終日握而手不掜，共其德也。」陸德明釋文：「握，李云：捲曰握。」 「 握 」也表示掌握、控制。《左傳‧閔公二年》：「衣身之偏，握兵之要，在此行也，子其勉之。」 「 握 」還指拳屈手指的手。元曹伯啟〈南鄉子‧四川道中作〉：「兩握不曾握，俯瞰飛流過石灘。」 「 握 」亦表示封、遮蓋。《紅樓夢》第19回：「急的襲人忙握他的嘴。」 「 握 」也用作量詞，指一手所能執持的量或一拳的長度。《禮記‧王制》：「祭天地之牛，角繭栗；宗廟之牛，角握。」鄭玄注：「握謂長不出膚。」
From the sound of " hand" and " house", the original meaning is to hold and hold. "Shuowen": "Snip it. From the hand, the sound of the house." The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diaolong‧ Harmony": "The shape of Zhang Hua is like holding a pestle." " Grasp" can mean flexing your fingers into a fist. "Zhuangzi‧ Geng Sangchu": "While holding your hands all day long, you share your virtues." Lu Deming explained: "Hold, Li Yun: Juan said to hold." " Grasp" also means mastery and control. "Zuo Zhuan-The Second Year of the Min Gong": "The body is biased, and it is necessary to hold the soldier. In this trip, I will encourage it." " Grasp" also refers to the hand with the fingers flexed. Yuan Cao Boqi, "Nanxiangzi-Sichuan Daozhong": "I can't hold two hands, I overlook the flying stream over the rocky beach." " Holding" also means to seal or cover. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 19: "Anxious Assailant hurriedly shook his mouth." " Grasp" is also used as a measure word, referring to the amount that a hand can hold or the length of a punch. "Book of Rites-King System": "The ox of the heaven and the earth has a cocoon and chestnut; the ox of the ancestral temple has a horn grip." Zheng Xuan's note: "The grip means that the skin cannot grow out."

握字的基本解释

握
wò
手指弯曲合拢，执持：握手。握拳。握别。把握。掌握。握力。握笔。握管。握瑜（喻怀有美好的才德）。
量词，指一把大小或分量：一握粗。

握字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wò］
［《廣韻》於角切，入覺，影。］
(1)执持。
(2)屈指成拳。
(3)指拳屈手指的手。
(4)掌握；控制。
(5)犹捂。封；遮盖。
(6)量词。指一手所能执持的量或一拳的长度。
(7)指把。
(8)通“渥”。厚，重。
(9)通“幄”。车帷。
[②]［òu］
［《集韻》於候切，去候，影。］
古时殓衣的一种。

握字的英文翻译

◎ 握
grasp, hold

握字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　握； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页443第07
〔古文〕?【唐韻】烏角切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】乙角切，?音渥。【說文】搤持也。陸佃云：持五指也，在外爲持，在內爲握。【詩·小雅】握粟出卜。【儀禮·鄉射禮】箭籌長尺有握。【註】握。本所持處也。【又】大夫之矢，則兼束之，以茅上握焉。【註】握，謂中央也。【禮·王制】宗廟之牛，角握。【前漢·律歷志】算法，用竹徑一分，長六寸，二百七十一枚，而成六觚，爲一握。　又【集韻】烏谷切，音屋。小貌。【易·萃卦】若號一握爲笑，鄭氏讀。【前漢·司馬相如傳】委瑣握?，拘文牽俗。【註】握?，局陿也。　又【爾雅·釋言】握，具也。【疏】握持辦具也。【鄭註】握卽屋字。　又與幄通。【周禮·春官·巾車】翟車貝面組總，有握。【註】有握，則無蓋矣。如今輧車是也。【釋文】握音屋，又烏學反。　又於?切，音漚。喪用束手者。或作䌂。

握字的源字形

握字的起名意思

本义：攥在手里，执持。

Basic explanation of words
grip
wò
Fingers bend and close, hold: shake hands. make a fist. shake hands at parting. grasp. grasp. Grip. Hold the pen. Hold the tube. Hold Yu (Yu has a beautiful talent).
A quantifier refers to the size or weight of a handful: one grip is thick.
grip

(4) Master; control.
(5) Still covering. Seal; cover.
(6) Quantifiers. Refers to the amount that a hand can hold or the length of a punch.
(7) Refers to the handle.
(8) Through "Wu". Thick and heavy.
(9) Through "幄". Car curtain.
[②]［òu］
["Ji Yun" in Hou cut, go to wait, shadow. ]
A kind of ancient funeral clothing.

握在手内。本义是拿住。

wò
1) держать (в руке); носить (в руках); с (чем-л.) в руках

握枪在手里 винтовка зажата в руке
2) владеть, обладать; распоряжаться
握篆 а) владеть печатью; б) перен. занимать пост
握政权 держать кормило власти, стоять у власти
3) хватать (рукой); брать (в руки); набирать в пригоршни

Radicals: 扌, 屋  (fingers, shop)
Meaning Mnemonic
You use your fingers in a shop to grip what you want to buy.
Imagine picking up a few different things in a shop. If something fits nicely in your grip: buy it. If it's too small or too big, put it back.
Reading Mnemonic
You have a really strong grip thanks to acupuncture (あく)! All your fingers are primed for buying things. You can grip anything at a shop—pineapples, tires, even live turtles. All thanks to some well-placed needles.
Acupuncture is great for strengthening your grip strength. If you do intense shopping (like I do) you should definitely consider it!
